action.action-desc: Mr. Miller of Florida introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Veterans’ Affairs

form.official-title: To amend title 38, United States Code, to improve the reproductive treatment provided to certain disabled veterans.

section.header: Reproductive treatment for certain disabled veterans

subsection.text: Chapter 17 of title 38, United States Code, is amended by inserting after section 1720G the following new section:

section.header: Assisted reproductive technology for certain disabled veterans

subsection.text: In addition to any fertility treatment otherwise furnished by the Secretary pursuant to this title, the Secretary shall furnish to a covered individual assisted reproductive technology.

In furnishing assisted reproductive technology to a covered individual under this section that consists of in vitro fertilization, the Secretary may provide not more than three in vitro fertilization cycles that result in a total of not more than six implantation attempts.
In carrying out this section, the Secretary—

paragraph.text: may only provide for cryogenic storage of genetic material of a covered individual for a period not exceeding three years, after which the covered individual shall be responsible for the payment of any costs relating to such storage;
may not possess, or make any determination regarding the disposition of, genetic material of a covered individual; and
shall carry out any activities relating to the custody or disposition of genetic material of a covered individual in accordance with the laws of the State in which the genetic material is located.

subsection.text: In carrying out this section, the Secretary may not—

paragraph.text: provide any benefits relating to surrogacy; or
assist with obtaining a third-party genetic material donation.

The term assisted reproductive technology includes in vitro fertilization or any other specific technology used to assist reproduction that the Secretary determines appropriate for purposes of this section.

subparagraph.text: a veteran, regardless of sex, who—

clause.text: is enrolled in the health care system established under section 1705(a) of this title;

such a disability includes an injury to the reproductive organs or the spinal cord of the veteran and such injury directly results in the veteran being unable to procreate without assisted reproductive technology; and

subparagraph.text: a spouse of a veteran described in subparagraph (A).

subsection.text: The table of sections at the beginning of such chapter is amended by inserting after the item relating to section 1720G the following new item:

toc.toc-entry: 1720H. Reproductive treatment for certain disabled veterans.
